subtopics.name: Decision-Making
subtopics.description: The process of selecting the best course of action based on available information and knowledge. This involves integrating theoretical understanding from epistemology and cognitive science to make informed decisions in real-world contexts.

subtopics.name: Problem-Solving
subtopics.description: The systematic approach to identifying and resolving complex issues. It leverages insights from philosophy of science to evaluate evidence and from practical wisdom to apply learned skills effectively.

subtopics.name: Ethical Reasoning
subtopics.description: The application of moral principles and values to guide actions and decisions. This subtopic draws upon ontology to understand the nature of ethical dilemmas and upon epistemology to validate ethical frameworks.

subtopics.name: Skill Development
subtopics.description: The continuous improvement of skills necessary for practical application. It integrates cognitive science to understand how humans learn and develop skills, and practical wisdom to ensure these skills are applied effectively in real-world scenarios.

subtopics.name: Contextual Understanding
subtopics.description: The ability to apply knowledge in diverse contexts, considering both the specific domain (e.g., science, ethics) and the broader interdisciplinary synthesis. This involves recognizing how different domains intersect and inform one another.
